title: HTTP Security
description:
Security through HTTP headers, including HSTS, HPKP, MIME-Sniffing prevention, Clickjacking protection, and others.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security/

allow_methods.title: Allowed methods
allow_methods.description:
An array with all the HTTP methods allowed, in uppercase.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/cors/

allow_origins.title: Allowed origins
allow_origins.description:
An array with all the origins allowed, examples of values are https://example.com, or * (any origin).

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/cors/

allow_headers.title: Allowed headers
allow_headers.description:
An array with the headers allowed. Missing headers in this list wonâ€™t be accepted.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/cors/

expose_headers.title: Expose headers
expose_headers.description:
List of headers that are safe to expose to the API of a CORS API specification.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/cors/

max_age.title: Max Age
max_age.description:
For how long the response can be cached.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/cors/

allow_credentials.title: Allow credentials
allow_credentials.description:
When requests can include user credentials like cookies, HTTP authentication or client side SSL certificates.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/cors/

debug.title: Development flag
debug.description:
Show debugging information in the logger, to be used only during development (defaults to false).

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security/
